text: Slovenia competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Open water swimming== Slovenia qualified one female open water swimmers. ;Women {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Špela Perše |align=left|Women's 5 km |58:12.1 |16 |-align=center |align=left|Women's 10 km |1:55:44.4 |27 |} ==Swimming== Slovenia entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Peter John Stevens |align=left|50 m breaststroke |27.50 |22 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:01.90 |39 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=3|Katja Fain |align=left|200 m freestyle |2:00.38 |22 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m freestyle |4:17.57 |26 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|400 m individual medley |4:48.24 |20 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=3|Neža Klančar |align=left|50 m freestyle |25.12 |18 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |54.88 |25 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|200 m individual medley |2:16.53 |24 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Tjaša Oder |align=left|800 m freestyle |8:30.97 |9 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |- |align=left|1500 m freestyle |16:10.14 |9 |colspan=2 |colspan=2|Did not advance |} ==References== World Aquatics Championships Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships 2019
title: Slovenia at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
